definitions.definition: A large open space for children to play in, usually having dedicated play equipment (such as swings and slides ).
examples: The kids have to go to the playground during recess, no matter the weather.
The local council have set up a new playground , equipped with slides , swings , and a climbing wall .

definitions.definition: Any physical or metaphysical space in which a person or organization has free rein to do as they please.
examples: The exclusive tropical island was a millionaire's playground .

definitions.definition: A sandbox for testing calls to an application programming interface .

main_definition: ( outdoors ) A large open space for children to play in, usually having dedicated play equipment (such as swings and slides ). [1780 ]
secondary_definitions: ( figuratively ) Any physical or metaphysical space in which a person or organization has free rein to do as they please.
( programming ) A sandbox for testing calls to an application programming interface .
